sites.name: Graz Clock Tower (Uhrturm)
sites.description: The iconic clock tower atop the Schlossberg hill, offering panoramic views of Graz. The city's most famous landmark.
sites.seasonal_notes: Visible year-round. Access via stairs, funicular, or lift.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed for viewing. Consider buying funicular/lift tickets in advance.

sites.name: Eggenberg Palace (Schloss Eggenberg)
sites.description: UNESCO World Heritage site, a magnificent Baroque palace with extensive gardens and several museum collections (Alte Galerie, Archaeology Museum, Coin Cabinet).
sites.seasonal_notes: Park open year-round; palace/museums have specific opening times, check official site.
sites.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online, especially for guided tours of state rooms.

sites.name: Styrian Armoury (Landeszeughaus)
sites.description: The world's largest original historical armoury, preserving around 32,000 pieces of weaponry, tools, suits of armour for battle and parades.
sites.seasonal_notes: Check official website for seasonal opening hours and guided tour times.
sites.booking_tips: Guided tours are recommended and sometimes mandatory for entry (check winter hours).

sites.name: Kunsthaus Graz
sites.description: Modern art museum known as the 'Friendly Alien' due to its unique biomorphic architecture. Features contemporary art exhibitions.
sites.seasonal_notes: Exhibitions change periodically.
sites.booking_tips: Check current exhibitions online. Part of the Universalmuseum Joanneum.

sites.name: Island in the Mur (Murinsel)
sites.description: An artificial floating island made of steel, designed by Vito Acconci, connecting the banks of the Mur river. Houses a cafe and small amphitheater.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round, nice spot for coffee.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed for access. Cafe seating might be limited.

sites.name: Graz Cathedral (Grazer Dom)
sites.description: Impressive Gothic cathedral, formerly the court church of the Habsburg emperors. Features significant artworks and architecture.
sites.seasonal_notes: Respect service times when visiting.
sites.booking_tips: Check for visiting hours outside of services. Guided tours might be available.

sites.name: Mausoleum of Emperor Ferdinand II
sites.description: An important Mannerist building complex housing the tomb of Emperor Ferdinand II and adjacent St. Catherine's Church.
sites.seasonal_notes: Check opening times, may be limited.
sites.booking_tips: Often visited together with the nearby Cathedral.

sites.name: Landhaus Courtyard
sites.description: A stunning example of Renaissance architecture, this courtyard within the Styrian government building features impressive arcades.
sites.seasonal_notes: Hosts events like Christmas markets in winter.
sites.booking_tips: Accessible during office hours usually, check for event closures.

sites.name: Glockenspiel
sites.description: Charming musical clock in Glockenspielplatz square. Figures emerge and dance to melodies three times a day (11am, 3pm, 6pm).
sites.seasonal_notes: Performance happens year-round.
sites.booking_tips: Arrive a few minutes early to get a good viewing spot in the square.

sites.name: Burg & Double Spiral Staircase
sites.description: Part of the Graz Castle complex, famous for its unique 'staircase of reconciliation' - two opposing flights that merge, separate, and merge again.
sites.seasonal_notes: Access might be dependent on government building hours.
sites.booking_tips: Check accessibility, as it's part of an active government building.

sites.name: Schlossberg Gardens
sites.description: Beautiful landscaped gardens on Schlossberg hill surrounding the clock tower, offering walking paths, relaxation areas and excellent city views.
sites.seasonal_notes: Most beautiful during spring blooms and autumn colors. Winter access may be limited by weather.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed. Can be combined with Clock Tower visit.

sites.name: Hauptplatz (Main Square)
sites.description: Historic main square of Graz with colorful buildings, the Town Hall, and the central Erzherzog-Johann-Brunnen fountain. Hub of city activity.
sites.seasonal_notes: Hosts seasonal markets and events. Christmas market in December is especially notable.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed. Many cafes and restaurants around the square.

sites.name: Natural History Museum (Universalmuseum Joanneum)
sites.description: Comprehensive museum showcasing natural history, geology, and zoology with extensive collections of minerals, fossils, and animal specimens.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with consistent exhibitions.
sites.booking_tips: Consider the Joanneum annual pass if visiting multiple museums. Check for combined tickets.

sites.name: Botanical Gardens of Graz
sites.description: Extensive botanical gardens with greenhouses, tropical plants, and themed outdoor areas. Run by the University of Graz with research collections.
sites.seasonal_notes: Different plants bloom seasonally. Greenhouses open year-round.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed. Check for guided tours or special exhibitions.

sites.name: Austrian Sculpture Park
sites.description: Unique outdoor park featuring over 70 contemporary sculptures set in landscaped gardens south of Graz. Part of the Universalmuseum Joanneum.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open seasonally from April to October. Closed during winter months.
sites.booking_tips: Check official website for opening dates. Accessible by public transport from Graz center.

sites.name: Farmers Market at Kaiser-Josef-Platz
sites.description: Traditional farmers market where local producers sell fresh fruits, vegetables, meats, cheeses, flowers, and regional specialties.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best seasonal products in spring and summer. Open year-round but busiest on Saturdays.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed. Come early for the best selection and atmosphere.

sites.name: Kunstgarten (Art Garden)
sites.description: Contemporary art space combining indoor gallery with outdoor sculpture garden, hosting rotating exhibitions by emerging artists.
sites.seasonal_notes: Garden area most pleasant in warmer months. Gallery open year-round.
sites.booking_tips: Check website for current exhibitions. Opening hours may be limited.

sites.name: Castlehill Slide (Schlo√übergrutsche)
sites.description: Europe's largest indoor slide, built inside the mountain. A fun alternative way to descend from Schlossberg hill after visiting the clock tower.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with consistent hours.
sites.booking_tips: No advance booking needed. Popular with families and children.

sites.name: Herz-Jesu-Kirche (Church of the Sacred Heart)
sites.description: Impressive Neo-Gothic church with the third-tallest church spire in Austria (109.6 meters). Features beautiful stained glass windows and interior.
sites.seasonal_notes: Respect service times when visiting.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed for general visiting. Check for special events or concerts.

sites.name: Museum of Perception (Muwa)
sites.description: Unique museum focused on sensory experiences and optical illusions. Interactive exhibits challenge visitors' perceptions and assumptions.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with some special exhibitions.
sites.booking_tips: Small museum, can get crowded at peak times. Check website for current exhibits.
